title: Citi Launches New Wealth Management Service Center in Qatar
summary: Doha - Citi launched its International Personal Bank Europe, Middle East and Africa (Citi IPB EMEA) Service Centre in Qatar with an event held at the Four Seasons, Doha, on May 14, 2012. The move affirms the bank's aspiration, as it celebrates its 200th anniversary, to address the growing needs of affluent clients in the Middle East region.
tag-1: Citi Launches New Wealth Management Service Center in Qatar
tag-2: Doha – Citi launched its International Personal Bank Europe, Middle East and Africa (Citi IPB EMEA) Service Centre in Qatar with an event held at the Four Seasons, Doha, on May 14, 2012. The move affirms the bank's aspiration, as it celebrates its 200th anniversary, to address the growing needs of affluent clients in the Middle East region.
tag-3: Citi IPB EMEA provides a comprehensive international wealth management proposition through its offshore booking centers in London and Jersey for clients who are looking to benefit from international investment opportunities to broaden their portfolio.
tag-4: Dedicated and specially trained investment managers based in the Citi IPB EMEA Qatar Service Centre will be able to help clients build investment portfolios tailored to their individual needs. Clients will have access to a diverse range of global investment products as well as multi-currency bank accounts, time deposits, foreign exchange services and 24/7 internet banking.
tag-5: "Since we began operations in Qatar in 2007, we have been committed to providing value-added services to our clients in Qatar and the region," commented Dr. Izzat Dajani, CEO of Citibank NA Qatar. "Citi International Personal Bank EMEA services are an integral part of our investor offer which caters to the financial aspirations of local investors, while fulfilling the requirements of expatriate investors who seek one point of contact for their global investment needs."
tag-6: Vipul Kapur, Business Head, Citi IPB EMEA, said: "Qatar is one of the fastest-growing economies in the world and has the sophisticated investor profile that will benefit from our offering. This makes our presence in Qatar an important step in our expansion in the Middle East region. We provide a unique palette of global investment opportunities and easy access to the international market with advice and support provided at the client's doorstep. We will ensure we put our accumulated wealth of global knowledge at the disposal of our clients residing in Qatar and offer a strong value proposition that satisfies their financial needs and objectives."
tag-7: Akash Samaiyar, Citi IPB EMEA Regional Director, MENA, added: "With the launch of the Citi IPB EMEA Qatar Service Centre, discerning target-market clients residing in Qatar will gain access to the bank's highly trained and certified investment staff based in Qatar, whose extensive relationship management advice will advantage clients' wealth portfolios. Clients will be able to open their accounts and take advantage of world-class financial products and services from either London or Jersey, two of the world's best known financial centers."
tag-8: Citi has a long history, deep roots and strong relationships in the Middle East and has been present in the region for nearly 50 years. Citi established a full presence in Qatar in 2007, when it opened its office at the Qatar Financial Center. Since then, Citi has established itself as a key player in Qatar in terms of corporate and investment banking services.
tag-9: Citi Citi, the leading global bank, has approximately 200 million customer accounts and does business in more than 160 countries and jurisdictions. Citi provides consumers, corporations, governments and institutions with a broad range of financial products and services, including consumer banking and credit, corporate and investment banking, securities brokerage, transaction services, and wealth management.
